Name: mawu
Doc:
The String object represents a string of characters.
It is used to store and manipulate text.
It is a sequence of characters, where each character is a Unicode code point.
The String object is immutable, meaning that once a String object is created, it cannot be modified.
However, you can create a new String object based on the original String object.
The String object is a wrapper around the Go string type.

Methods.Name: kumalizaNdi
Methods.Doc: This method checks if the string ends with the given string.

Methods.Name: peza
Methods.Doc: This method finds the first occurrence of the given string in the string and returns it.

Methods.Name: pezaZonse
Methods.Doc: This method finds all occurrences of the given string in the string and returns them.

Methods.Name: format
Methods.Doc: This method formats the string with the given arguments.

Methods.Name: kutalika
Methods.Doc: This method returns the length of the string.

Methods.Name: gwirizana
Methods.Doc: This method checks if the string matches the given regular expression.

Methods.Name: maloMwa
Methods.Doc: This method replaces all occurrences of the given string with the new string.

Methods.Name: gawa
Methods.Doc: This method splits the string by the given string and returns a list of strings.

Methods.Name: yayambaNdi
Methods.Doc: This method checks if the string starts with the given string.

Methods.Name: toLowerCase
Methods.Doc: This method converts the string to lowercase.

Methods.Name: kuNambala
Methods.Doc: This method converts the string to a number.

Methods.Name: kuMawu
Methods.Doc: This method converts the string to a string.

Methods.Name: toUpperCase
Methods.Doc: This method converts the string to uppercase.

Methods.Name: chepetsa
Methods.Doc: This method removes whitespace from the beginning and end of the string.

Methods.Name: chepetsaKuMapeto
Methods.Doc: This method removes whitespace from the end of the string.

Methods.Name: chepetsaKuchiyamba
Methods.Doc: This method removes whitespace from the beginning of the string.
